page.title: 17Monmouth's Ash
page.content: The Duke of Monmouth was Charles the 2nds eldest illigitimate son. Monmouth himself was in exile in Holland when the crown was taken by his catholic uncle James 2nd. The Duke, a protestant set sail from Holland in 1685 and landed with Dutch mercenaries at Lyme Regis,where he recruited further local militia to fight the king and gain the crown. The two sides met near Bridgewater at a place called Sedgemoor. A supposed surprise attack ended in disaster, the Duke and his army were put to flight. On July 8th he was captured close to a hollow ash tree between Horton and Verwood.Monmouth was found crouching in a ditch. Although the ash has long since died,saplings have grown from the bowl & the spot has ever since been refered to as Monmouth's Ash.
